title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 3559/81 of 8 December 1981 on the classification of goods falling within subheading 85.15 A III b) 2 of the Common Customs Tariff
header:
COMMISSION REGULATION (EEC) No 3559/81 of 8 December 1981 on the classification of goods falling within subheading 85.15 A III b) 2 of the Common Customs Tariff
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
Alarm clock radios, consisting of a plastic casing containing a radio and a quartz electronic clock which allows the radio to be switched on automatically at any chosen time, having also a tuning scale, a light-emitting diode (LED) display and several push-buttons for controlling the radio and for setting the clock, shall be classified in the Common Customs Tariff under subheading:
85.15 Radiotelegraphic and radiotelephonic transmission and reception apparatus ; radio-broadcasting and television transmission and reception apparatus (including receivers incorporating sound recorders or reproducers) and television cameras ; radio navigational aid apparatus, radar apparatus and radio remote control apparatus:
A. Radiotelegraphic and radiotelephonic transmission and reception apparatus ; radio-broadcasting and television transmission and reception apparatus (including receivers incorporating sound recorders or reproducers) and television cameras:
III. Receivers, whether or not incorporating sound recorders or reproducers:
b) Other:
2. Other

This Regulation shall enter into force on the 21st day following its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities.  (1) OJ No L 14, 21.1.1969, p. 1. (2) OJ No L 172, 22.7.1968, p. 1. (3) OJ No L 335, 21.11.1981, p. 1.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 8 December 1981.
For the Commission
Karl-Heinz NARJES
Member of the Commission
